title: Cancelled appointments
body: Far two many cancelled appointments makes it hard for people coming from afar more so at 72 keep moving the appointments to Saturdays when engineering work on the rail system prevents ease of travel

title: Amazing Service
body: Brought our 2  year old daughter into Teddington Walk In Clinic  at 7 pm on a Saturday evening . Was greeted by a friendly receptionist and asked to wait . Within five minutes my daughter was seen and a dislocated elbow was popped back into place . The Nurse was reassuring and calm while completing the procedure . Delighted with the friendly and speedy service we received .

readBy.name: Hounslow and Richmond Community Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Staff lie
body: Staff leave you in an awful state. Then lie about the situation. They then leave you and dont care if you want to harm yourself. If you ask for help from them they ignore you.

title: Great practice, helpful staff
body:
I went re my eyes. I was seen within a few minutes.
Receptionist Tania was helpful and I saw Nurse practitioner Lucy Murray who put my mind at rest

title: Excelant Friendly Hospital
body: I attend 3 different departments and my overall experience is always the same, very friendly and helpful staff who make you feel special every time. We at Brentwood are extremely fortunate to have such a special Hospital close by. I have been attending this Hospital for 16 years and not once have I found any unhappy staff member. They all get 10 out of 10 for service to the community. Thank You Brentwood Community Hospital.

title: Professional care
body: I was an outpatient for an unpleasant procedure/examination. I received excellent care, consent asked throughout, everyone courteous, and professional. Excellent care, so thanks to busy doctors and nurses. Apologies to the lovely nurses whose hands I squeezed, hope I didn’t hurt you.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Awful service at Urgent Treatment Centre
body: Called NHS 111 and doctor recommended going to A&E. Arrived at A&E for Children and were seen fairly quickly by a nurse. So far so good. Nurse decided our 7 month old baby could be seen by the GP in the Urgent Treatment Centre (walk-in) and said that if they wanted A&E to see him they could always refer him back. We walked down to the UTC and it was a tiny room crammed full of patients with standing room only. The wait time was in excess of 2hrs even for a 7month old baby. There was no where for us to sit or any privacy to nurse my baby. If you weren’t sick before, you’d likely leave having caught something from one of the other patients waiting since the room was so over crowded. Decided since A&E nurse decided baby wasn’t urgent enough to see a doctor in A&E that they can’t feel his illness was serious enough, and promptly left before he caught anything else or started screaming the place down! Absolutely awful service!

title: Excellent
body: I was treated with the upmost care during and post surgery. Everything was fully explained, I was reassured and the treatment was successful despite being more significant than originally expected

title: Difficult to get to talk to anyone on the phone
body: I find it’s getting more and more difficult to talk to a person let alone getting an appointment to see a GP

title: Deeply disappointing
body:
I live in the East Riding and am suffering from depression. I contacted Humber's Emotional Wellbeing Service to get an appointment. To my deep disappointment I was told that there are no available appointments for face to face appointments. The Emotional Wellbeing Service is not taking on new patients. This was really disheartening. When I was told this my heart sank and I felt utter despair. 
What is the point of us taxpayers paying for an NHS service that is unable to offer its services to the public ? Questions need to be asked about the Emotional Wellbeing Service. Why is it not taking on new patients ? Is this due to a shortage of qualified professionals to treat patients ? Are we looking at a service which is being poorly led and mismanaged ? When is this service going to start taking on new patients again ?
I am so disappointed and troubled by this situation that I am considering reporting it to the CQC and the CCG. It is small wonder that Humber keep losing services to CHCP. The inability to take on new patients is a total failure. It is nothing short of a disgrace. Come on Humber, wake up and get your act together. You are failing the people of the East Riding big time !

title: Good experience at the casualty/minor injuries…
body: The unit is easy to get to, being on the outskirts of the town, and parking is free!  I was seen immediately and sent down for an x-ray.  My only criticism is that I had a broken foot and the nurse did not suggest my husband got a wheelchair to take me there, and it was a long walk.  We later saw that wheelchairs were available but hadn't noticed them on our way in.  All the staff were pleasant, and we were out within an house, my foot having been encased in a surgical-type boot.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Caring and compassionate
body: My 92 year-old father-in-law was rushed into Bedford South Wing hospital this last week and I just wanted to record my appreciation and that of his wife and daughter for the care and compassion shown to him. All the staff, from the paramedic who responded to the call-out to the hospital medical staff, were patient, caring, friendly and reassuring. Thank you.

title: Poor service of communication
body: I have recently moved to this practice and I can appreciate the service is busy since the move but it is so hard to make an appointment and often when you need an emergency appointment the service has no appointments for 3 weeks. Recent experience of a triage appointment was also bad and the gp was not understanding and quite rude. Attempted to contact the surgery to complain and I have had no reply. Improvements are needed as there is good potential and some really nice doctors at the service.

title: Really helpful
body:
The staff were very helpful and explained everything that was going on.

The surgeon was able to explain more to me that I heard from anyone else

title: Compassion, Professionalism, Sense of Humour.
body: I recently had to go into hospital to have a small operation on my leg. I attended the Wellcome Short Stay Unit where by I was looked after by a lovely young lady Health Care Assistant. She clearly new her job and did it with expertise and a sense of humour making me feel at ease and looked after. Several people came to see me all who treated me with compassion and professionalism. From the Junior plastic surgeon who explained everything meticulously, to the reassuring anaesthetist who gave me onfidence and put me at ease. What amazing people YOU are. From the moment I lay down in the operating theatre I felt relaxed thanks to YOUR efforts. I was cold and you gave me warm blankets, you reassured me everything was fine. I would just like to say thank you to the team who looked after me. You work in a very difficult and stressful environment and I think sometimes people forget that your only human. People forget the long hours you have to endure day in day out. If you have to wait hours for your operation, it's because there is a crisis somewhere else in the hospital - do not take it personally. Thanks again to the special team of people who looked after me so well... God bless

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Positive experience in outpatients and day surgery
body: Despite feeling anxious, I had a positive experience at Frimley and was left very impressed particularly in comparison to other nearby hospitals. Information was accurate and communicated well, and appointments were quick to come through and easy to change when I needed to. The atmosphere was nice, it felt comfortable and friendly, and all staff were professional and thorough. I had my own small room and the surgery staff were friendly and skilled, and I was left feeling impressed with the quality of the hospital and grateful for the NHS, at a time when we know it is under such pressure. Thank you!

title: Greatly improved
body: I feel the service has improved a lot over the last couple of months.  My calls are answered, and I can speak to staff over the phone, book appointments and see a doctor much more easily than before and without getting absolutely stressed.  I commend my nurse and thank you to reception staff for the human touch.

title: Excellent service
body: Friendly and efficient staff, clean and comfortable waiting areas.Clinical staff informative and reassuring .Felt in safe hands throughout the procedure.Highly recommed the clinic.Thankyou to all the staff.

title: Care of the elderly
body: My husband was admitted to ward 4 from Cramlington with a suspected stroke or delusion from an infection.He was treated with care and respect from the very first moment of his arrival until the moment of his departure from this world.All members of staff were caring and considerate and kept us informed every step of the way.They made my husbands end of life calm and peaceful and we can never thank them enough for making this stressful time easy for us.thanks a million

title: team works well together
body: Due to being transported by medicar, I arrived at 6.45am and was immediately assisted by a nurse from the department on her way to work. The team registered me and completed all the paperwork well before the start time of 7.30am. However, when the surgeon came, he told me that the operation couldn't go ahead because I was taking antibiotics. The nursing team then consoled me and plied me with tea and biscuits until transport arrived to take me home. It appears that I will have to wait another month before I get a further appointment but if the staff then are as  nice as this time, I have nothing to fear.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good and effective care
body: We have recently had experience of A&E, MAU and Haygarth ward. The care was usually excellent, staff friendly and efficient and we were kept informed most of the time. Our admiration for the nursing and ancillary staff on Haygarth ward is boundless, as the conditions they were working in were extremely challenging,  but they met the challenges with professionalism and good humour.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: Fabulous staff
body:
I brought my husband into A&E yesterday.
I cannot praise enough all the Staff from reception through to Acute Medical Unit, and all areas in between.
We met so many lovely staff who explained every step of the way and put our minds at ease,making our visit as stress free as possible.
He is home safe and sound.
Thank you everyone.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic care
body: My care was second to none. Right from the surgeon, nurses, and everyone included in my care. Food was lovely. Place nice and clean. Nothing was to much trouble for anyone. Thank you seems so inadequate, but words are not enough.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Amazing level of care
body:
Having fallen from a horse on 19/2, I attended QE2 with back/neck pain. Was referred to Lister for a spinal X-ray. 
The nurse in triage saw me within 5 minutes and shortly after a Consultant came a got me. Walked me through to Resus and I was faced with a team of doctors and nurses. At first I was embarrassed with the amount of attention I was receiving but am now immensely grateful that they treated my symptoms as worst case scenario. Within about another 20 minutes I was strapped to a back board having a contrast CT scan on my back/neck. Thankfully I was given the all clear and allowed to leave a couple of hours later. 
At all times I was informed of what was happening to me and made to feel completely looked after. I honestly cannot fault the quality of the service that I received.

title: Doctors who care
body:
I must say my doctor, has been fantastic,  she has been very caring , doesn’t rush through the appointment and takes time to listen to my concerns. As an adult you do know when you’re not feeling right and it really helps when your doctor takes note of this and works with you to find a solution. 
In recent weeks I just made up my mind that I want my health to be on track, no matter what. 
Your first point of contact are the staff who take our calls to book an appointment, in time they will sort themselves out. Although fair to say it is not all of staff who have a bad attitude. In recent weeks I’ve had to attend the surgery on a regular basis, the ladies on the front desk have been lovely. How you are treated as a customer, can impact on your heath because you are phoning or visiting the surgery to make an appointment because you are not feeling well. If they are polite to you it goes a long way.

title: Transport problem
body: I was booked in at Newcastle Under Lyme for pre med assessment, but by mistake the transport driver had instructions to take me to Warrington. The staff there were superb, taking the mess-up in there stride, asessing myself and 3 other Newcastle patients on top of their normal workload. The manager went out of her way to lay on some fruit and cake because we would be delayed longer than expected.

title: Perfect Surgery
body:
Been registered with this GP for 28 years. 
Never had a bad experience with the service. Dr Jaiswal is amazing and all the staff at reception go above and beyond. 
I will remain a patient here for as long as the Dr and staff stay. 
Always get seen to within a timely frame and a professional manner.

title: Lovely people
body: My husband & I have recently joined this surgery. Everyone we have dealt with has been patient & kind, and we have felt listened to. Thank you to all involved for making us feel cared about.

title: Good care, BUT...........
body: Care of my 90 year old mother was good, no problems here. The problem is with the discharge, it seems the left hand does not talk to the right hand. Nurses arranged transport home, I arranged carers for 7am, nothing happened. No one had talked to the ambulance crew to see if they were available, they weren`t. organised for a later in the day return, that happened but then they didn`t have the correct wheelchair to come down 5 stairs, of which they had been told of MANY times, she was bumped down the stairs with the brakes catching the steps as they came down. All in all you would think this was the first time they had done this. The hospital care was good but please talk to people involved before booking things.

title: Great practice
body: The doctors are very kind and they always look for the best solution to treat their patients. I would highly recommend this surgery.

title: Terrible
body: Surgery has gone down hill since the main Drs have left. The receptionist are rude and don't know how to speak to people. And nothing ever seems to be done regardless of the complaints you put in. The response you get back is " oh I wasnt aware of this" a new 3 strikes and your out has been put in place the letter then send home is actually very patronizing. Complaining if your a few minutes late but yet your waiting an hour and a half to see the dr. What police is in place when that is happening. I cant see this policy online and have never recieved a letter about it previously so why are we only hearing about it when they send you a warning. If it wasnt for the fact my medical history is so complex I would leave

title: Super care
body: Your receptionists are super-helpful, and your nursing staff have been really caring to my relative who is your patient. Thank you so much - I really do appreciate it.

title: Lovely staff
body: Spent a couple of days on B3 ward - the staff were so lovely and pushed for the best care possible. Really appreciated the work they do, couldn't recommend them enough.

title: Uncaring
body: In Aug 2019 my wife died after fighting cancer for 10m. The first time we actually had a visit from a Dr showing any sort of interest or compassion was only a couple of weeks or so before she passed away. Since she died over 6 m ago I have not personally had any contact from the surgery to offer condolences or support to me should I need it. I accept other support is made available to help with my grief but I just feel that a caring local practice would have shown more compassion and support, I know surgeries are ever more stretched but even a call just to offer support and enquire about my own health in my grief would have been nice.

title: Terrible practice
body: I rang yesterday to be told to ring at right today, phone answered 15 minutes later asked to see a doctor she asked my symptoms when I told her she said they were full, can you explain if I was sixteenth in line how they could be full.  They didn’t even ask how I had the symptoms I have now decided to change doctors

title: Staff put you at ease straight away - very…
body: This was my second operation at the Stoneygate Eye Clinic. Everything went smoothly as before. Staff put you at ease straight away - very friendly.

title: Quick response to query.
body: I popped into Arnside House on a Tuesday to ask if the prescribing team could “up” some of my medication ie insulin needles and Creon, both of which are used ad hoc. By the Friday of that same week my prescription had been changed without any fuss or the need for 20 questions. This saves me having to call and order these items almost on a fortnightly basis. The receptionist was efficient and sent the task as I was there and the prescription team were also very efficient in getting the job done. We are quick to complain when things don’t go our way but how often do we praise when they do? So, thank you to the team at Carlisle Healthcare.

title: Rude Unprofessional Staff
body: Asked to attend walk in centre by Dr on 111 and met by a po faced churlish receptionist who needs basic training on how to interact with the public. Then had the pleasure (!) of an interaction with the security man when explaining that my car was parked in a disabled bay. He was equally truculent and dismissive. Wake up CCHC there is a CCG to complain to and I intend to do that. After a career working in the NHS, I am in the perfect position to comment. Truly awful service to a patient.

title: Shocking surgery!
body: I've had to complain about this surgery twice now.. the 2nd time I haven't even had a reply! They just tell you want you want to hear! Nothing changes.. one thing about this surgery if you have mental health issues they dont even understand... not interested in listening even when you tell them that you struggle to visit the surgery all they keep doing is sending appointment letters for a medical review that's been done and I still cant get my medication coz they clearly dont read your notes! Nearly 2 weeks ago I put in a complaint and I'm still waiting for a reply to it!

title: Blood tests
body:
It would things easier if one could book blood  test appointments online. (I know this is a service that is provided by staff from one of the hospitals but if your (ie GP surgery) staff do the booking on the telephone, it's hard to see why they couldn't be included in the online booking system). If this isn't possible, could you publicise exactly when the appointments are released for booking - I've been told to phone 3 weeks before the test is needed and also told 4 weeks.  Is it a rolling, daily release of appointments or just once a week or ...?  
(I'm having to arrange a blood test every 2 or 3 months - for an elderly relative before a hospital appointment - and find I sometimes miss the available appointments and have to trek to King George's).  Thank you.

author: Mucka
title: Unhelpful nurse
body:
Went to Coventry walk in centre was seen within 45 mins.  
A nurse called me into their room, my face was swollen and jaw was hurting I thought I had an abscess but the nurse rudely said I had not!.  
I said I really was in pain so what was the cause,the nurse clearly stated again it was not an abscess but said could be an infection so I asked for some antibiotics but they said no but I could wait for 4 hours or more to see someone else.  
I declined cos of the pain. I seen my gp the following day and got antibiotics I feel this nurse should not be in this profession, was rude and showed no empathy.

author: Sick of being treated like an idiot
title: Wanting to see a dr
body:
I have been with this practice over 60 yrs and the deterioration is amazing. The appt system is ridiculous and not patient friendly at all. The staff have been so unhelpful and act like doctors instead of clerical staff.  
I wanted to see a doctor after having a nasty fall, I was told I could see a nurse practitioner, but I want to see a doctor I said, since when was it a receptionists job to decide who I need to see? How can a busy practice work with one doctor?  
I feel like a nuisance when I have to deal with this practice and patient care has certainly been lacking, I think it’s a disgrace.

author: Sporttammy
title: The outcome for my son could have been quite severe
body:
I contacted nhs111 for some advice about my son who was in severe stomach pain. Appendicitis was suspected by the gp earlier in the day and we were told to phone 111 if his symptoms worsened.  
My son was in a lot of pain and was vomiting whilst I was speaking to the person on the phone. Even after all the info and symptoms I gave over the phone, the person did not alter their queries or seem concerned at all, they just continued reading instructions off the screen which were not helpful at all. I was told that a doctor would call me back.  
A Dr phoned back, and after hearing my son's symptoms, said his pain was not in the correct place for appendicitis and he wouldn't have fallen asleep if he had appendicitis. In fact, at this time, my son's appendix had actually perforated, providing him temporary relief from the pain.  
In the morning, I took my son to the gp again and we were immediately directed to A& E. My son underwent emergency surgery that same evening for a perforated appendix. Without the swift intervention of the gp and the staff at NDDH, the outcome for my son could have been quite severe!

author: zm2020
title: Getting an appointment
body:
Rung up this morning and was told I had an appointment at 9.30 am at Kensington Practice, also was put on hold and told my daughter had made an appointment for me, of which when I arrived at Kensington Practice, was told there was never an appointment in my name. While there I rung again to find out how was on hold from caller number 23 to number 1 then they hung up saying all appointments were taken for today  
Am disgusted, someone got the appointment because I didn't get any confirmation and it's surely not rocket science. I thought things had changed but no, it seems a leopard will never change its spots.

author: Patient1004
title: Poor patient care and communication
body:
I had been waiting for a gynaecological referral for many months (since Aug 2019). After hearing nothing and chasing my GP a few times they finally called CUH and I was given an appointment within two weeks, however the day before they cancelled and moved it back another month,  
I finally had my appointment yesterday and had to wait for 50 minutes. In the appointment the Dr diagnosed me with endometriosis and told me I could either have a coil or keyhole surgery. The doctor asked me to make a decision then and there and I had to ask many further questions to understand my options better.  
Whilst the nurse went to find me a leaflet on the coil, I asked if they had further information on endometriosis. The doctor said no. A gynaecologist, diagnosing me with endometriosis, & didn’t have any further information to share. I was told that I could find the information online.  
Whilst the nurse was finding a pamphlet I noticed the desk in front of me was strewn with other patients’ personal details; I could see one patient’s surname, DOB, history of cancer and miscarriage. Totally unacceptable.  
I felt rushed, pressured and it was hard to understand what the doctor was saying to me. The same doctor also talked over me a lot. I felt this was an awful service.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Sickgirl
title: Urology day surgery
body:
I received a stage 1 SNS under local anaesthetic at the New Victoria hospital for urinary retention. On the day I was told I would get a local and if I struggled I could get sedation, during the surgery I was crying and shouting out in pain and despite a few encouraging words I received no care or treatment to make this more bearable.  
I was only able to get one probe implanted, instead of 2, as I found the pain too unbearable and wasn't offered sedation. This could impact the outcome of my treatment and would have been managed if I could have received the right treatment. The nurse also acted with very little compassion in regards to my pain and being upset with this.  
Post operative I was in a lot of pain and was only given my regular painkillers which had no effect, and when asked about this I was told I was "over emotional" as I had been tearful prior due to previous poor experiences. I felt this was so rude and completely unacceptable to not treat the pain I was expressing, which I thought was something that was taught to nurses that pain is susceptible and different between people and to treat the pain as expressed by a patient not how they perceive it.  
On discharge I was told I would be contacted every 2-3 days, and if I had any issues I had two points of contact to reach out to. This week I have experienced issues, but neither of the contacts given have been available. The contact numbers are useless and my emails have been unanswered despite being in pain and needing help. I have had to reach out to a doctor for help or advice on who else I can speak to.  
Overall the whole experience has been traumatising, upsetting and not to the standard I would expect of the NHS. I am so disappointed overall and I am now dreading the 2nd stage and having to deal with the same staff, who I've had such a bad relationship with.

title: Needs an overall
body: Needs an over all of they practice, have to wait to long on the telephone over half hour! then cannot get an appointment ,not that day or any other day, will not take advance bookings. left not knowing what to do,?

title: Rude
body:
Been using this practice for years and have always had a great experience with the doctors but when it comes to the receptionists it’s a different story.
9 times out of 10 as soon as they answer the phone they are rude and start to talk down to you. I understand they may be under pressure but I don’t call the doctors to be spoken down to. It’s as if you’re an inconvenience to them so they’ll do whatever they can not to help. This seems to be a more common occurrence and others I speak to that also use this surgery agree.
It’s just totally unnecessary.

title: Excellent Friendly Service
body: I attended the Harold Wood polyclinic for an ultrasound. I was seen on time the staff are very friendly and helpful and put me at ease at every stage of the procedure. I would highly recommend attending her Wood polyclinic.

title: Very Caring Staff
body:
I had an ICD implant in 2018 and return for regular
Pacing and Cardiology clinics. Every visit is a pleasure
and the staff that I meet all appear to be caring and
great at doing the best for their patients.

title: Routine appointment dates too far in advance.
body: One day I hope to write a positive review for this medical practice. Unfortunately it’s not today. I’m registered to use the patient access online booking system. However if you have a future appointment the system will not let you book an appointment unless you cancel the existing appointment. So if you have an appointment for a routine blood test (or anything) a whole month away you cannot use the system to make an advance appointment to see a doctor. So you have to telephone. This morning I dialled at precisely 08.00 to get a busy signal. I then over the next 20 minutes dialled a further 53 times. The phone was answered shortly after 08.20 on my 54th attempt. You are then in a queue. I waited on hold for a further 11 minutes before my call was answered. I have got an appointment in three weeks time which is not ideal. This is what the website on Monday 02 March 2020 states about routine advance appointments “We have more routine appointments available up to two weeks in advance.” I think that statement should now read three weeks in advance to be more accurate.

title: Really good practice
body: I’ve been a patient here for some years and have always thought that Ritchie Group is really good. This review is prompted by having been for a test that can be uncomfortable, but was not at all on this occasion. The nurse who treated me was a very skilled practitioner and made the appointment very, very easy. More generally though, I have always had excellent care from this practice. Everyone is very kind and I’ve always been able to get convenient appointments or, when needed, a walk in appointment. I once came in for a walk in appointment and wasn’t well enough to get home to wait. They managed to squeeze me in and get me seen very quickly. They really are excellent.

title: Not really helpful
body: I had an appointment with a very nice nurse, sadly in my case it did not really help. I have had the ulcers for weeks and seen a nurse in hospital every 2 weeks, who took photos of my condition. I had taken photos myself for this appointment and I was hoping to see someone who could elevate my pain. The very nice and sympathetic nurse just told me, I had to see a consultant, which was not possible on the day. I am still waiting for someone to help me.

title: Poor experience
body: I had an appointment to see the nurse on the 14/02 at Foden street surgery Stoke. The appointment got cancelled due to the nurse been ill and then she was off for 2 weeks annual leave, (this can’t be helped and everyone needs a holiday.) The receptionist booked an appointment for myself on the Saturday at a Hanley surgery which is completely unacceptable as I live around the corner from Foden Street Surgery Stoke. Then trying to book another appointment was a nightmare. When I am with the nurse and she books my next appointment it is always at the same time 4.30/4.45 the receptionist was unable to book this time as only the nurse could book this timeslot. So the next appointment that was available was 09/03 at 3.45pm but she would speak to the nurse to see if I can get an appointment for 4.30/4.45pm, I rang on 02/03 at 8.30am only to be told that those timeslots have been taken whilst the nurse was on annual leave. When an appointment has been cancelled by yourselves then this should be taken as priority as it was cancelled at no fault of my own. Also when the nurse is on annual leave get cover as this would be the most logical solution. Over the last couple of years this practice has gone down bank, there used to be four doctors and 2 nurses now there is only one full time doctor and one nurse, this is not a great experience at all. I would move doctors but Trent Vale is not much better as I moved from there to Foden Street.

title: 0 Appointments
body:
Just trying to book a smear test. Can't get through on the phone, haven't been able to for WEEKS. I try every day. It's not like I'm even on hold, the phone just cuts you off. I'm not able to get to the surgery easily to just queue to make an appointment for weeks later. 

I then get a reminder letter to book a smear and STILL can't get through on the phone. HUGELY disappointing.

title: Great staff
body: Had to visit A&E as my grandson had cut his head open ,he is two years old. Receptionist was lovely and informed us wait time. Waiting area very disappointing and crowded. No separate area for children which there usually is in hospitals. The next room we were sent into was very crowded. I just managed to get a seat and needed one as I was carrying my grandson. It was awful, very hot, loads of people and no information. A screen would have been helpful. We were shown to a cubicle and were treated by a nurse. She was brilliant. She thoroughly checked my grandson cleaned his wound and glued his cut. She told my daughter what to do and gave her leaflets explaining what to look out for. The treatment was first class. Thank you very much.

readBy.name: The Hillingdon Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: test Dan moderator
body: please don't reject until test complete. checking functionality please don't reject until test complete. checking functionality please don't reject until test complete. checking functionality please don't reject until test complete. checking functionality

title: A caring professional service
body: I have nothing but praise for the Doctor's and reception staff, the professional approach to all questions and information that a patient may ask. To the staff of the surgery, you are a person, not just a name on the other end of the phone.

title: Lovely practice
body: Always made welcome nothing is to much trouble, dr,s nurse,s and reception,s really helpful. Will go out of their way to help you, i have been at this practice for over fourty years and would not go anywhere esle.

title: Brilliant doctor
body: Dr Rasol is such a great doctor. He has always been there for my family. So understanding and caring. Weather its mental heath or any other illness we have had including saving my little girls life! We owe Dr Rasol alot! Hes exstreamly thorough and we always leave his sugergy feeling alot better knowing he's helped. Could not ask for more hes such a brilliant doctor.

title: Great practice every one was helpful
body: I am pleased with the service and everyone helped me great service wonderful easy to find and quick Sean so I don’t know what to say very pleased

author: M-mum
title: Put at ease straight away
body: My son was referred to OT for hand writing and fine motor skills. He was seen by Alison (Ali) in the south paediatric team at arrol park in Ayr. She was fab with him. He suffers from anxiety and she put him at ease straight away.

title: Need to review appointment system
body:
I have been trying for three weeks to make an appointment for a medication review, I am unable to see any appointments online despite NHS guidelines stating that up to 50% of appointments should now be available for online booking.

If you phone to book one they have nothing available to book in advance, you must phone in the mornings at 8am, I am at work at 8am so this is impossible for me.

author: EvBly88
title: My first admission
body:
I have nothing but praise for every member of the hospital staff in Dumfries hospital. As it was my first time ever being admitted I was very worried how it would be. All the staff were very friendly and caring. No issue was too big. I was in a lovely private room with my own bathroom. The food was absolutely amazing, I've no idea why anyone would complain about it. Every nursing staff I met spent time with me and almost felt like friends. It made my stay much more pleasant whilst feeling so ill. I wish I could remember everybody's names, but thank you to everyone in B3 that looked after me till I was discharged. Even the cleaners were a joy to chat to. I now have no fears if I ever have to be readmitted.  
Thanks so much

title: Appointments system
body: The appointments system is not for the workers. We are not allowed to use our phones on the factory floor only at break times, by then all appointments have been allocated!! we don't always need to be seen urgently just need a routine appointment which you can't get. Walk in centres won't refer you to a consultant if need be they just say contact your doctor!! One big circle and still got no appointments

author: furball
title: Failed to listen to my concern
body: I feel that the doctor failed to listen to my extreme concern re: a recently prescribed medication and was not only patronising, but seemed to be mocking the symptoms like I was a fool. I came to this hospital due to lack of care at another. A month after this appointment I am still shocked at this behaviour as well as now knowing my GP hasn't even been written to.

readBy.name: Basildon and Thurrock University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body: I have always found the staff very friendly and helpful at High Street Surgery. The level of care has always and continues to be fantastic.

title: 24 h blood pressue Monitor
body:
Had a 10.30 am appt. Arrived at 10.10am monitor was fitted and I was on way home by 1.15. 

Brilliant service .

title: Aggressive and officious
body:
Rang for an appointment was refused 
Rang again for a Telephone consultation 
The receptionist was aggressive and officious
Totally unnecessary

title: Cancellation
body: After waiting for an appointment for our 4 yo son for longer than desired, c.3 months, we received a phone call the day before our appointment to cancel it because the Consultant is on annual leave. Surely this could have been foreseen more than with one day's notice. Work schedules and childcare arrangements had been altered and ultimately our poorly boy is still no nearer to receiving the treatment on the NHS he desperately needs. GPs can prescribe antibiotics, but this is not solving the problem and he is building resistance. Very sad at this experience and hope more notice will be provided for others in the future for this department at Bedford. We wait to hear when we will receive another appointment with the hope, if not belief, that it won't be another 3 months of living with daily pain.

title: Great Doctor
body: I had been experiencing this problem for a long time and saw a young student doctor a couple of times and I have to say he is lovely, kind and very knowledgable and would be a great asset to this surgery if he came back after his training.  I have never had any problems with this surgery they have always been helpful to myself and my family. The problems concerning getting appointments is the same all over the country because there aren’t enough GP’s so let’s encourage this lovely trainee to come back.

title: Excellent service
body:
I have emailed the triage service on two or three occasions since I joined the practice six years ago, and have always found them to be incredibly helpful. 
Speaking to a doctor to answer my queries in a timely manner reduces anxiety and gives speedy access to treatment such as antibiotics. 
Working as a full time nurse, it is difficult to take time out of work for appointments so, where appropriate, this service offers an excellent alternative. 
Thank you for all of your help.

author: Great full service user
title: Elective Surgery & HDU
body:
A big thank you to all staff involved in my care in my recent journey through the system when having an elective procedure. I came in through DSU where all staff and students were great. When taken through to main theatres number 2 all staff in there were lovey even sang happy birthday to me as it was the big 40, helping put me at ease. I don’t remember much of my next stage of my journey until I woke up in HDU I can’t thank enough the Day Nurse, Liz, who cared for me for two days she was fantastic and such a caring compassionate nurse. Also the two male nurses on the nightshift in HDU Kevin & Mark I think (am terrible with names), they were very good at their jobs.  
I was moved to ST 3 for 12hrs prior to discharge and Lorna the nurse and the auxiliaries and students were all lovely. As a nurse myself was strange seeing it from the other perspective that as a patient. Where thanks and great service is deserved you deserve it all.

author: middy
title: Kind, polite and understanding
body:
I was admited for steroid injections. I was very nervous, and scared, the nursed in the unit were amazing, makeing me feel relaxed, and in theartre everyone was very understanding, and efficient.  
From my arrivial to my discharge,everyone in the unit was kind,polite and understanding. I was given all the information I required, as was my husband, the enviroment was friendly and clean, and obvious care taken with every patient.

title: NOT JUST A NUMBER
body:
Excellent Service!  
Staff - Doctors, Nurses & the reception team - are wonderful. Very welcoming, amiable, personal & friendly. 
Never have to wait long for an appointment and appointments rarely run late. You never feel like merely a number in a system with this dynamic and friendly super team. Thank yo all.

author: Babsy49
title: Impressed with how the service has adapted
body: I attend regularly for venesection and over the past twelve months have been fantastically impressed at how the service has been adapted.   No more waiting for a long time until the busy staff can attend to you.   There is now a designated Venesection Nurse who is fantastic. Well done Catherine and team! .

author: FrzR
title: Shoulder injury
body: Shoulder injury sustained at work attended ayr emergency department excellent efficient service by all. In particular Wendy the ENP thank you for all your help today hopefully on mend soon.

title: Waiting room comfort
body:
THis fantastic surgery gives a high quality service. The staff are very friendly and at the same time very professional. However, I have a small criticism to offer.
In the upstairs waiting room there used to be two lines of chairs facing the lifts (plus a small line under the windows). That wasn't comfortable for those waiting or those arriving.
Now the two lines are facing each other. That might be better for those people arriving n the lifts, but it's not comfortable for most people waiting to see a doctor to have to sit eye-balling other patients.
Why not rearrange the chairs into rows of 3 - 4 chairs facing in the same direction as the chairs under the window? 
That's if the chairs that you have will allow you to do this.

title: Worst Practice ever
body:
I tried to book an appointment - I was told to call between 8 am to 9 am so I called next day at 8.40 they said it fully booked and advised me to call again next day so I did at 8.10 am again it was fully booked (their reason was that there's only 1 doctor working today and rest of the doctors are not in) and again advised me to call again next day which I did at 8.30 am and they were fully booked again.
Previously being able to book an appointment to see the GP via Patient Access was an excellent benefit. However, now, the Surgery has introduced and 'Morning appointment service only' and no GP appointments in the afternoon. Only telephone consultations are now offered in the afternoon and You CAN'T MAKE FUTURE APPOINTMENTS. 
I do not understand why they have changed the appointment system. What happens to patients with Physical medical issues who need to be seen in person but cannot attend the surgery in the Moring due to work commitments and those with children who need to attend school. I truly think this system needs to be reconsidered and it is and will cause a huge inconvenience to patients.
Their staff are extremely RUDE!!!!!
 Unfortunately, I will now have to consider looking for a new GP.
I am not sure or understand why there are 5-star reviews in here and if you look at google reviews its completely opposite.

title: DIFFICULT TO CONTACT .
body:
None of the numbers on the website are longer in use , one would have thought that if the surgery was customer satisfaction based this would have been amended in the first instance ?

The new number for repeat prescriptions is constantly engaged and even though there is talk of an internet address to order I have never found it .

God knows what has gone wrong but this is situation is amateurish at best , in some cases dangerous .

title: Exceptional practice
body:
Expert advice and direction by the doctor on duty for ongoing skin issue for my daughter. An overall solution was recommended to help provide the best level of care for this ongoing issue.  Throughly felt our needs were cared for and considered and a solution put in place for both today and the future. The doctor even took his time so my daughter could understand the importance of managing this issue daily as a priority.Thank you as always to the great team at Emerson’s Green. 
The reception team also managed the appointment process with skill and ease - again thank you.

readBy.name: NHS Bristol, North Somerset and South Gloucestershire CCG

title: Difficulty in Getting in Touch
body: Extremely difficult to get through to make an appointment on the telephone.  Still cannot get through to anyone other than automated service telling me I'm in the queue but never seeming to get further down the queue.  I was never advised of the amalgamation of practices within the Centre.  Still trying to get through.

author: FjMum
title: Feeding Support
body:
I had a very hungry baby on my hands from day one and feeding was going rather well. However, about 4 days after coming home my baby just would not latch, we were both crying and stressing. To top it off the midwife had just informed me the baby would have to go back up to hospital as her jaundice would need treatment. How was I going to get to hospital (30mins away) when my baby hadn't even had a proper feed all morning? Queue more stress and crying. I had already met Lana, our feeding support worker as she had come to visit us during our pregnancy to answer all the questions I had about breastfeeding. She was so friendly and made sure I knew she was there for support whenever required. So I gave her a ring. She assured me all would be fine and she was popping into to see us before the hospital appointment. When she arrived she put me right at ease, we had a talk about what was going on and how we might improve the latch. I then tried to feed with these tips and voilà my hungry baby was back on feeding like a trooper. Lana stayed till the feed was done and I was confident that we were back on track with feeding. The baby slept the entire journey back to hospital. I have no doubt that journey would have gone down like a lead balloon had Lana not taken the time to come support me before hand.  
Further down the line (6-8weeks old) our little one developed really bad gas that she struggled to pass. This made her feeding patterns change dramatically and I worried that her latch was maybe cause some extra wind. Again, I was able just to give Lana a quick text and she arranged to come for a visit. She put me at ease about baby gas, checked out our latch, checked tongue tie then gave me some really useful info about baby massage, colic hold and use of a sling to ease my babies discomfort. By the time she had left I felt confident again that I had more tools to help my baby get back to her usual self.  
Being able to see a feeding support worker on a weekly basis has been a godsend on my feeding journey. Just a week or so ago (4months old) I noticed my baby was just not getting as much milk as she needed/wanted at nights. I was able to just have a quick chat with Lana, who again was so knowledgeable about helping keep up with my babies demands. Giving me techniques to improve the supply and ensuring me that my body will meet my babies new demands after a short transition.  
I had always intended to breastfeed my baby for the health benefits for us both. I never envisioned how difficult something so 'natural' could be and if it wasn't for the feeding support workers (Lana in my case) there is no way that I'd still be breastfeeding by almost 5month old.

title: Registration
body: Spent some effort to come to GP using crutches due to leg injury just to be turned away as they do not accept paperwork for new patients on Mondays and also are unable to make a copy of ID and receptionist requested to bring a copy next time, last thing i want to do whilst injured. Could not see this info on their website. P.S. If they cannot make a scan of doc in 21st century,this put a large question if they stuck 20th.

author: Tangle123
title: Breastfeeding on leaving hospital
body: I didn’t produce breastmilk as quickly as expected/hoped. The nurses in hospital helped with latching techniques but baby was not weighed and I was not checked to make sure I was producing milk before leaving hospital. Baby lost a lot of weight and ended up with jaundice so we arrived back at hospital a day after being let home. The nurses were very helpful in hospital however extra checks would have helped a very distraught baby and helpless first time mum during their first night at home. My baby is now on formula as I was too nervous to continue trying breastfeeding (although milk did come through a few days later) as on formula I now know my baby is definitely feeding well.

author: M17
title: Colonoscopy and Gastroscopy
body: Excellent care and service from all staff who made me feel relaxed and well informed.

title: Brilliant service
body: I was in for a suspect lump to be removed, I would like to say from the booking to procedure being done to checking out this department was first class, the put my mind at rest all the way from start to finish. A big thank you to all the staff involved well done.

title: Professional and friendly
body: After having sustained a distressing injury to my hand I was delighted with the quick,professional and friendly attention I received from all the staff.I was surprised with the level of detail taken to assess my problem and other procedures put into action that I would have never considered necessary for a minor injury-that I have since discovered where important! the whole experience was faultless from start to finish and the staff deserve great credit for their work.It saved the day for me and I am grateful to them.

author: What can I say
title: Pre Operative Assessment
body:
This was the first time I needed to attend this clinic but my experience there was so good that if it had to be repeated, I would have no concerns. From the welcome I received and throughout all the procedures to obtain the information which was required, I met with efficiency blended with understanding and friendliness which put me completely at ease.  
The staff were busy but concentrated on patients feeling relaxed and I would like to thank and congratulate all of them for providing a superb service.

readBy.name: Taunton and Somerset NHS Foundation Trust

author: GotMeAgain
title: Getting to the correct building
body: Despite a previous complaint that letters were not directing patients to the correct building, & the response stating it would be dealt with- here we are 6 years later & the letter is EXACTLY the same - even the filename is the same! Beggars belief that patients are still being made to turn up at one place & be sent to another when they’re about to undergo day surgery & may be stressed. It’s an easy fix! ! Come on bookings - sort it out!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: Mv1946
title: Couldn't fault the service
body: Received physio@home care couldn't fault the service. Still continue with my exercises given by the physio.

author: Shadikins
title: Breastfeeding support workers
body: I just wanted to celebrate the brilliant work done by the feeding support workers at Raigmore hospital. I found them to be fair understanding, caring and really helpful.

title: Wonderful Practice
body: I have been with the practice for the last 30 years, and have always been treated with kindness, and good medical care on the few occasions  when I've needed it . Last year they helped me manage a tricky medical condition,  that was complicated by me staying with my father who was dying 100 miles away. And today, i phoned with a concern that could potentially  be serious,  and will have a call back  today.

author: dh2020
title: Child birth experience was fantastic
body:
We have just had our second child at the Borders General Hospital in Melrose. Our experience, as with our first child, was fantastic so this is a shout out to the fantastic team they have there. Our first child was born after a very long labour with the baby in a “back to back” position which meant a huge amount of pain for my wife. The team dealt with the situation very professionally and an epidural was decided upon once it became clear that the labour was taking too much out of my wife / the pain was getting too severe. This allowed her to get some rest and meant that when the time came, she managed to push our son out quickly. The aftercare my wife received both immediately after giving birth and then the assistance which she received in getting established with breastfeeding and general first time mum stuff was brilliant.  
Our second child was slightly more straightforward (no epidural this time but an induction due to early waters breaking but labour not onset) but nevertheless the care we received was just brilliant. One of the things we like about the BGH is that there is a familiarity there that made us feel incredibly at ease (Joan , who looked after my wife before and during labour this time round , looked after her post labour last time, and so on). I think this says great things about the department as they clearly have a great base of loyal , committed staff.

title: New appointment system isn't working
body:
From January, patients are only able to access a doctor via telephone/online appointments daily from 8am. Same day, 10 minute slots are available to book a doctor to call you back. In my experience, it is impossible to log in online around 8am as so many people are trying to do the same, similarly on the phone, ( I was number 14 in the queue at 8.10 this morning..) If you book online, there is no access to your own doctor, appointment allocation is random.
This first come first served system is deeply floored, particularly in relation to emergency access. It is time consuming and stressful to be struggling with this process in the morning and I'm sure for some patients, it is impossible to do due to work/child care etc.,
In January, I was told by a receptionist that a doctor would call me "late afternoon"the same day but I would get a text message to give more details later, (which I never received). I missed the call as I was unable to receive calls at the time it was made and was berated by the receptionist for not answering! 
I appreciate changes had to be made. (I have stood outside the surgery from 7.30-8am many times in order to make a same day appointment, which is clearly not ideal).
I sincerely hope this is a trial and will be reviewed soon. Surely there has to be some way of discriminating between  patients that need same day access and those that don't. I also think there should still be some provision for patients being able to walk into the surgery and make an appointment, particularly when it's not urgent.
I would like to add that apart from this organisational issue, I am totally satisfied with the medical provision at the surgery. I have been registered there for almost 20 years and have been happy with the services provided during this time.

author: Cloudless
title: I would have liked some written information
body:
The audiologist I saw was very pleasant and knowledgeable. I would have valued written information to support the conversation, which was rather an information overload.  
So much was said during the appointment that I haven’t been able to remember most of it. I think the gist was that there’s nothing that can be done about tinnitus so try not to think about it.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

author: Birdofthyme
title: Referral for autism assessment
body:
Gp told me to go to education department in council to get my child assessed for autism. Refused to accept that it's the GP that has to do the referral.  
I'm at my wits end in trying to get help for my child. My mental and physical health is suffering accordingly.  
In addition to dealing with my child's still unsupported needs, I have the extra burden of fighting to even get on the extraordinary long waiting list before he eventually gets to see a professional. This is incredibly cruel and has already caused undue trauma and suffering.

title: Rude
body: I visited the walk-in centre and the receptionist was incredibly rude! the women was moaning/complaining that I had come to the walk in centre today in front of the whole waiting room full packed of waiting patients, even sighing and nodding her head saying how she wasn’t happy! I felt so embarrassed I waited near the enterance doors to be called through. I visited today as I had a few spots appear on my arm and wanted to know what it was (might be chicken pox/might not be!!!). She definitely didn’t have any patient care at all and would never recommenced to anyone who visits... the receptionist definitely needs to work of patient skills because today she had none.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

author: Anonymous 176
title: They run the service so efficiently
body: I regularly attend the phlebotomy department at Coatbridge for diabetic management. The nurses here are amazing. They run the service so efficiently meaning there are no long waiting times. The staff are always friendly and genuinely take pride and care in their jobs, ensuring you are comfortable during your visit. The atmosphere in the room is very relaxed and the skill shown in taking bloods effectively in comparison to other experiences I have had.

author: CaDa
title: Giving birth
body:
We gave birth to our first child a week before Christmas 2019.  
Although it was our first Baby we felt so welcomed to Raigmore. The staff was beyond attentive, friendly and just awesome. A bit of mind reading had to be involved!  
The whole experience was so pleasant for us as first time parents. Even after giving birth we couldn’t have imagined a better place to be at that moment. The staff was always so helpful, patient and explaining.  
We were allowed to go home the next day, but still can’t thank the staff enough for being there for us.  
Even now, almost 11 weeks later, we sometimes drive in the car and talk about the experience in Raigmore and how much we appreciated everyone.
